intro: Tetraplasandra oahuensis, commonly known as Oahu's native pandanus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Oahu. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in spikes, which eventually develop into fibrous, pineapple-like fruits. Tetraplasandra oahuensis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and thrives in well-drained soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various native fauna.
